title: Solopreneur Defaults for PRD Creation
description: Standard assumptions applied when discovery questions go unanswered during PRD creation. Optimized for solo founders and small teams building MVPs.

revenue_model.rationale: Recurring revenue provides predictable cash flow and higher valuation multiples

pricing_structure.rationale: Simple structure that covers evaluation, individual, and power user segments

free_tier.rationale: Reduces friction for user acquisition, enables product-led growth

payment_processor.rationale: Industry standard, excellent developer experience, global coverage

billing_cycle.rationale: Monthly for cash-conscious users, annual for better retention and cash flow

frontend_framework.rationale: Widely adopted, excellent ecosystem, great developer experience, SEO-friendly

backend_framework.rationale: Shared language with frontend reduces context switching, large ecosystem

database.rationale: Battle-tested, scalable, integrated auth and real-time features

frontend.rationale: Optimized for Next.js, excellent free tier, automatic deployments

backend.rationale: Simple deployment, good free tier, database hosting included

authentication.rationale: Integrated with database, includes OAuth providers, Row Level Security

file_storage.rationale: Integrated with database and auth, simple API

email_service.rationale: Developer-friendly, good free tier, React email templates

target_user_tech_level.rationale: Broader market appeal, forces simplicity in design

mobile_support.rationale: Most B2B SaaS users access via desktop, but must work on mobile

help_support.rationale: Scalable for solo founder, self-service reduces support burden

notifications.rationale: Avoid notification fatigue, respect user attention

mvp_feature_count.rationale: Focus over breadth, faster time to market, clearer value proposition

admin_panel.rationale: User self-service preferred, admin features add complexity
admin_panel.mvp_alternative: Direct database access for admin tasks

team_collaboration.rationale: Single-user first, team features are significant scope addition
team_collaboration.future_consideration: P1 for post-MVP if user research indicates need

api_access.rationale: Only if core to value proposition, adds documentation and support burden
api_access.exception: Include if product is a developer tool or platform

export_import.rationale: Minimum viable data portability, covers most use cases

analytics_dashboard.rationale: Show users their progress without complex data visualization

search.rationale: Simpler implementation, sufficient for typical MVP data volumes
search.threshold: Consider server-side search if >1000 records typical

mvp_development.rationale: Aggressive but realistic with focused scope and modern tooling

alpha_duration.rationale: Internal testing and bug fixing before external users

beta_duration.rationale: Enough time for meaningful feedback, not so long users lose interest

time_to_first_revenue.rationale: Account for marketing ramp and sales cycle

gdpr.rationale: Required by law, fines are significant

ccpa.rationale: Required by law for California users

data_retention.rationale: Balance between compliance and recovery capability

cookie_consent.rationale: Minimum compliance, don't over-engineer for MVP

terms_of_service.rationale: Legal protection, can use template services

security_audit.rationale: Focus on secure development practices first, formal audit when funded

never_build_yourself: Email delivery - always use email service
File storage - always use cloud storage

environments.rationale: Staging is nice but adds cost/complexity for MVP
environments.post_mvp: Add staging when team grows or deployment risk increases

ci_cd.rationale: Vercel/Railway provide this out of the box

usage_instructions.when_to_apply: Apply these defaults when a discovery question goes unanswered during PRD creation
how_to_override: Explicitly answer the discovery question during PRD creation
Add override to the Preference Profile after generation
Document the override in the Assumptions Log with rationale
usage_instructions.assumption_risk_tracking: All applied defaults should be logged in Section 7.3 Assumptions Log with risk assessment
usage_instructions.review_frequency: Review assumptions when market conditions change, user feedback contradicts defaults, or scope changes significantly

metadata.purpose: Reduce decision fatigue and accelerate PRD creation for solopreneurs
metadata.target_audience: Solo founders and small teams building B2B SaaS products
metadata.update_process: Defaults are updated based on industry trends and user feedback
